lead_paragraph: “I’m sorry, and I will fix it,” he said in a State of the State address in which he focused on an issue that has consumed the state and drawn national attention.

byline.contributor: Julie Bosman reported from Lansing, and Mitch Smith from Chicago. Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington, and Abby Goodnough from Flint, Mich.
byline.original: By JULIE BOSMAN and MITCH SMITH

headline.main: Gov. Rick Snyder of Michigan Apologizes in Flint Water Crisis
headline.print_headline: ‘I Let You Down,’ Governor Says of Flint Crisis

abstract: Michigan Gov Rick Snyder publicly apologizes for water contamination in Flint, acknowledging role of government in catastrophe; offers more detailed assessment of situation than given previously and promises to release more information, but leaves several questions unanswered; pledges to fix situation.
